content:
The readme needs to be a lot more exciting and helpful and concise. The current readme can mostly be discarded. Here's a bunch of random thoughts to incorporate into it. Also incorporate the Quick Start Guide language. Massage the language.

- SOTA LLMs are good enough today to output full files, liberating you from editors and auto-complete. Ballistic is built to take advantage, allowing you to work on a high level with trust without ever touching an editor.
- Enhanced AI chats supercharge development, making it trustworthy and effortless without ever touching an editor.
- the execute/write/diff/undo buttons are a key improvement on normal LLM chats.

- If you get stuck, describe the problem the best you can, then add: . Afterwards copy & paste the logs in.
- Give project-content.txt a scan to make sure your important files are in there. Otherwise the AI tends to hallucinate them.
- strategies for keeping context length down? 
- This project was created with Claude 3.5 in mind. GPT-4o works ok for simpler tasks, but Claude 3.5 is the first LLM that seems good enough for real software development like this.


- Mention that ofc this project eats its own dogfood. You can see the prompts that have been used to improve it in the .modification-prompts directory. 
--- These are saved in the commits - maybe a commit someday will only be its prompts!
- How to get Claude & OpenAI API keys?

- the system prompt can be edited at /public/system_prompt.txt
- You can bump up against rate limits when continuing long conversations with images in them, as the images are included in each reply.

Try again. Getting Started should be before quick start and give copy & pastable commands. Analyze the project closely and figure out the most important parts of the project. Emphasize that this is a new transformative way of developing software.
